data.title: Mistaken Decimal Addition
data.solution:
n = int(input())
s = sum(int(d)*2**i for i,d in enumerate(reversed(str(n))))
print(bin(s)[2:])
data.statement:
Oh no! You made a mistake during one of your CodinGame puzzles.
You thought the inputs were in decimal, but they were actually in binary!

You were supposed to add 9 binary numbers together and print their sum in
binary, but you've lost the original input and now only have the sum of
the numbers added using decimal addition.
```(wrong)    (right)
  1111        1111
  0101        0101
  0111        0111
  0101        0101
  0000        0000
  1111        1111
  0001        0001
  0001        0001
+ 0001      + 0001
------      ------
  2538      110010```
Recompute the correct binary sum from the incorrect decimal sum.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A decimal integer [[n]] computed from mistakenly adding 9 binary numbers as if they were decimal.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The sum of the original 9 binary numbers in binary.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Oh no! You made a mistake during one of your CodinGame puzzles.
You thought the inputs were in decimal, but they were actually in binary!

You were supposed to add 9 binary numbers together and print their sum in
binary, but you've lost the original input and now only have the sum of
the numbers added using decimal addition.
(wrong)    (right)
  1111        1111
  0101        0101
  0111        0111
  0101        0101
  0000        0000
  1111        1111
  0001        0001
  0001        0001
+ 0001      + 0001
------      ------
  2538      110010

Recompute the correct binary sum from the incorrect decimal sum.




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A decimal integer n computed from mistakenly adding 9 binary numbers as if they were decimal.

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1: The sum of the original 9 binary numbers in binary.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
0 <= n <= 2147483647

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
2538

         

         

            
Output

            
110010
